What steps shall be taken in the context of Israel's annexation plans? Who has the power to act? Join us for a debate about accountability and obligations of companies and governments towards trade with illegal settlements THURSDAY, 21 MAY 2020 – 5 PM CET/ 4PM IRELAND/UK/ 6 PM PALESTINE TIME Join us via this link https://us02web.zoom.us/j/89797605467 or on the Facebook live ECCP (European Coordination of Committees and Assocations) page PANELISTS: Michael Lynk – the UN Special Rapporteur for the situation of human rights in occupied Palestine Dr Anna Kdair – Legal Researcher and Advocacy officer, Al-Haq Prof Tom Moerenhout – Columbia University’s School of International and Public Affairs Clare Daly - member of the European Parliament (Ireland)
RREUSE is an international network of Social Enterprises with members across Europe and the U.S.A active in re-use, repair and recycling.

Description: The Foundation for Middle East Peace (FMEP) and the Middle East Institute (MEI) invite you to join a 3-part webinar series: “Annexation & What it Means: Views from the Ground & Around the World.” Israel has been de facto annexing land in the West Bank since the inception of its military occupation of Palestinian territories following the 1967 war. Now, under the new Netanyahu-Gantz government in close coordination with the Trump Administration, the Israeli government is poised to formalize and massively expand the extent of that annexation. What will this mean for Palestinians, for Israelis, and how has the international community responded? Once annexation is enacted, what happens next? This three-part webinar series, co-moderated by FMEP’s Lara Friedman and MEI’s Khaled Elgindy, will engage leading voices from Israel and Palestine, in addition to U.S., European, and Arab perspectives Part 3 Features:
soja wwf - import af soya til svineproduktion

title: webinar on "Fracking, plastics and the climate - the unknown nexus and its implications for the European Green Deal", which I co-organise on from 16:00-18:00 together with MEP Jutta Paulus and Heinrich-Böll-Stiftung European Union. The webinar will be among others attended by Prof. Robert Howarth from Cornell University in USA. Please see below further details and link to registration.

PlasticsEurope has sponsored and contributed to the Plastic Leak Project (PLP) - a multi-stakeholder initiative co-founded by Quantis and ecodesign center EA in partnership with 35 public, private and scientific organisations – which delivers the first science-based methodology to map, measure and forecast plastic leakage along their value chain. These insights provide sustainability managers and corporate decision-makers with a strong foundation to translate their commitments to tackle plastic pollution into effective strategies and actions that meaningfully address plastic leakage. Following a yearlong collaboration and rigorous testing of the methodology through pilot projects with Arla Foods and textile brand Sympatex Technologies, the full PLP Methodological Guidelines and accompanying Brief are now publicly available. See download button below.

Please join us this Thursday for the second in our series of online “Climate Talks”. Our special guest will be Jos Delbeke, Professor at the European University Institute and a former Director-General at DG Climate Action. Jos will be joined by Peter Vis, Senior Advisor at Rud Pedersen and former head of cabinet to Climate Action Commissioner Connie Hedegaard. Jos and Peter, architects of the original EU Emissions Trading System (ETS), will exchange views on the proposed changes to the ETS laid out in the European Green Deal. The discussion will be moderated by Simon Taylor, Rud Pedersen’s Senior Advisor.

title: The European Climate Foundation (ECF) and Ecologic Institute are pleased welcome you to an online conference on the forthcoming EU Climate Law. We want to create an opportunity to exchange views on the European Commission’s proposal, with evidence and insights from experts and policy-makers. We hope this will help to kickstart the debate on an informed and forward-looking basis. The draft agenda is presented below. 1) Welcome * Erica Hope, Director, Climate Planning & Laws at European Climate Foundation 2) Why does the EU need a climate law? * Sharon Turner, Visiting Professor at University College London and Sussex University 3) Climate Laws: good practices, key elements and implications for the EU law * Climate laws in the EU: Good practice examples from Member States - Matthias Duwe, Head, Climate at Ecologic Institute (15min presentation) * Q&A * A climate law for the EU – what does it need to contain? - Dr. Nils Meyer-Ohlendorf, Head, International and European Governance Senior Fellow at Ecologic Institute (15min presentation) * Q&A 4) Panel reactions and audience discussion: The EU Climate Law proposal: making policy consistency a reality? Chaired by Erica Hope * Stefanie Hiesinger, Member of the Cabinet of Executive Vice-President for the European Green Deal, Frans Timmermans at European Commission * Elisa Giannelli, Researcher at E3G * Sharon Turner, Visiting Professor at University College London and Sussex University * Alex Mason, Senior Policy Officer, Climate & Energy Policy at WWF European Policy Office Q&A and closing (which may go beyond the 90 minute mark, depending on interest and availability)

en europæisk brancheforening som repræsenterer den europæiske parallelimport sektor. Vi har mødtes en enkelt gang i denne kontekst på Saarland’s repræsentation. I Danmark udgør parallelimport 26% af al medicin som bliver solgt på apotekerne. Som organisation repræsenterer vi omkring 120 virksomheder som udgør omkring 80% af den samlede omsætning i sektoren. Omsætningen i sektoren er 5.7 milliarder Euro årligt. De danske parallelimportører er blandt de største i Europa. Jeg skriver fordi medicinmangel i Danmark og EU er et stigende problem. Vores sektor bliver ofte sammenkædet med nogle af disse problematikker, og vi vil derfor gerne mødes og fortælle hvordan vi handler, hvilke regler vi er underlagt, og vores indsats for at modvirke medicinmangel, og ikke mindst hvad der kan og bør gøres på europæisk plan for at imødekomme problemet. Vi ved at ENVI nu sætter en INI rapport i gang om emnet, hvorfor vi gerne vil mødes så snart din kalender måtte tillade det.

title: The L&F-NNF agenda is about promoting the framework conditions and earnings for the agriculture, food industry and employees in the Danish food industry: • Maintaining common high standards for food products and food hygiene both internally in food trade between EU countries but also in the conclusion of trade agreements with third countries • Promoting free trade at a fair level with high standards for food in both quality and hygiene, compliance with ILO core conventions • Climate, in a sustainable way towards farmers, the food industry and employment • Politically triggered trade conflicts between the EU and…. affecting primary producers, the food industry and employees - measures against, inter alia, the revision of the Regulation on the European Globalization Fund and other common EU instruments (Brexit, USA First, etc.) • Rejection of a common European minimum wage In this context, we naturally intend to touch on the forthcoming Green Deal, the land-to-table strategy, agricultural policy and the EU's overall budgetary framework.

title: Denuncia de las condiciones de trabajo e incluso violencia física de los enfermos y reclamación de que se respete la directiva de seguridad en el trabajo

Este colectivo está integrado por camareras de piso con un alto nivel de inseguridad laboral. Este grupo, compuesto principalmente por mujeres, sufre de enfermedades derivadas de una carga de trabajo excesiva, subcontratación, horas extras no remuneradas y bajos salarios, lo que lleva a un problema de feminización de la pobreza. Este grupo también denuncia que en España no se aplica la "Directiva 89/391 - Directiva marco sobre salud y seguridad en el trabajo". Solo en España hay más de 100.000 mujeres en esta situación.
Preocupaciones acerca de la posible regulación de un salario mínimo interprofesional a nivel europeo
